algorithm_technique: Iterate through rows and columns, using sets to check for unique elements.
Bit manipulation (XOR) to check for presence of numbers.
problem_summary_simple: Verify if an n x n matrix contains all numbers from 1 to n in every row and column.
problem_summary_technical: Check if each row and column set has size n, ensuring all numbers 1 to n are present.
key_insights: Using sets is an efficient way to check for unique elements in a collection.
The `all()` function in Python is useful for checking conditions across an iterable.
The problem requires checking both rows and columns independently.
The XOR approach relies on the property that x ^ x = 0 and x ^ 0 = x.
This solution attempts to use XOR to detect missing or duplicate numbers, but it's flawed for this specific problem.
The provided XOR solution is incorrect because it doesn't account for the range of numbers (1 to n) and can produce false positives.
